alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 4:15AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jackson, northeastern Madison and southwestern Franklin Counties through 500 AM CDT... At 414 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of New Market, or 11 miles east of Moores Mill, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huntland, Skyline, Gurley, Pleasant Groves, Hytop, Maysville, Princeton, Jericho, Estillfork and Brownsboro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
